definition.name: Fetch API Data
definition.description: This action will handle authenticated API requests, allowing you to save the data from the request into your workspace.
definition.author: James Ives <iam@jamesiv.es>

inputs.name: endpoint
inputs.description: The URL of the endpoint you would like to retrieve data from.

inputs.name: configuration
inputs.description: Any applicable configuration settings that should be set such as authentication tokens. You can reference secrets using the secrets syntax, or you can reference data returned from the `TOKEN_ENDPOINT` request using the triple bracket syntax.

inputs.name: token-endpoint
inputs.description: If the `ENDPOINT` API requires you to make a request to get an access token prior to fetching data you can perform this task by specifying a token endpoint. Any data returned from the token end can be referenced in the `CONFIGURATION` variable using the triple bracket syntax.

inputs.name: token-configuration
inputs.description: Any applicable configuration settings that should be set such as authentication tokens. You can reference secrets using the secrets syntax.

inputs.name: retry
inputs.description: If you are working with an intermittent API you can toggle this option to true. Doing so will make the action try the request 3 times at random invervals before failing.

inputs.name: save-location
inputs.description: By default the save location of the JSON file is `fetch-api-data-action/data.json`, if you would like to override the directory you can do so by specifying a new one with this variable.

inputs.name: save-name
inputs.description: You can override the name of the exported `.json` file by specifying a new one here. You should _not_ include the file extension in your name.

inputs.name: variable-name
inputs.description: You can override the name of the variable name the action exports. This will work so long as set-output is true.

inputs.name: set-output
inputs.description: Determines if the returned data should be saved as an environment variable or not. This field defaults to `true`, but depending on your API response length you may need to toggle this.

inputs.name: debug
inputs.description: If set to true the action will log the API responses it receives in the terminal.

inputs.name: format
inputs.description: Allows you to modify the format of the saved file, for example you can use txt here to save the file as a txt file. This field defaults to json.

inputs.name: encoding
inputs.description: Allows you to specify the encoding the saved file, can be of type BufferEncoding: "ascii" | "utf8" | "utf-8" | "utf16le" | "ucs2" | "ucs-2" | "base64" | "latin1" | "binary" | "hex".

outputs.name: fetchApiData
outputs.description: The requested data from the API stored as a string.
